SEARCH
Package com.app.txt.transfer.impl

Class TransferImpl<T,U>

java.lang.Object
com.app.txt.transfer.impl.TransferImpl<T,U>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the key in the map
U - the type of the value in the map
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transfer<T,U>
@Component public class TransferImpl<T,U> extends Object implements Transfer<T,U>
Provides implementation for transferring data between files and objects.

This class handles both reading data from a file and writing data to a file.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • read

      public Map<T,U> read(String filename, LineParser<T,U> lineParser)
      Reads data from a file and parses it into a map using the provided LineParser.

      The file is read line by line, and each line is parsed into a map entry. The resulting map contains the data from the file as key-value pairs.

      Specified by:
      read in interface Transfer<T,U>
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to read from
      lineParser - a LineParser used to parse each line into a map entry
      Returns:
      a map containing the data read from the file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments are null or empty
      RuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • write

      public void write(String filename, T t, Function<T,String> prepare)
      Writes an object to a file using the provided Function to prepare the data.

      The object is converted to a string using the provided function, and then written to the file.

      Specified by:
      write in interface Transfer<T,U>
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to write to
      t - the object to be written to the file
      prepare - a Function that prepares the object for writing by converting it to a string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments are null or empty
      RuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs
